properties.address: The Green, Amington, Tamworth, Staffs B77 4AD
properties.description: Place of Welcome opens EVERY Thursday 2-4pm (apart from Christmas holidays) for drinks, cakes, quizzes, jigsaws and occasional craft, all ages welcome - free of charge, donations welcome. Baby Ark is a Stay and Play for Babies and their carers - Monday 1:30 - 3:00pm Term time ONLY and The Amington Ark is for Pre-schoolers and their carers - Thursday morning 9:00 - 11:30am Term time ONLY. Find us on Facebook to book a space for the Ark activities.

properties.address: Warwickshire County Council, Atherstone, Warwickshire CV9 1AX
properties.description: Warwickshire Libraries, offer a comfortable safe environment for everyone to use and our free services will help to keep some of your costs down. You don’t need to be a library member to visit – just pop in. Choose to spend time reading, studying, working and using free library WiFi; tackle a jigsaw, play a board game, become absorbed in mindfulness colouring or join in our free library events and activities for all ages to make friends or learn something new. https://www.warwickshire.gov.uk/directory-record/593/atherstone-library-and-information-centre

properties.title: Coleshill Town Hall Warm Room

properties.address: Hurley Allotment, off Ferndale Close, Hurley CV9 2NX
properties.description:
Our new community gardens are open 3 times weekly for the opportunity for socialisation, free refreshments (donations welcome) and community gatherings. We offer a variety of activities from art, gardening and exercise in order to promote health and wellbeing of residents. This is open to residents of Hurley and all surrounding villages. Organisations such as citizen advice, neighbourhood watch etc will be invited to offer guidance and advice.

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.
properties.title: Hurley Community Gardens

properties.address: Stockingford Community Centre, Haunchwood Road, Nuneaton, Warwickshire CV10 8DY
properties.description:
At Stockingford Community Centre, we serve free meals every Wednesday, including bacon batches, hot toast, porridge, cheese toasties, and beans on toast. Donations are appreciated. This initiative brings the community together to support the centre and help reduce poverty. It’s a safe space where people can meet new friends, connect with volunteers, and enjoy fun activities like board games. It’s more than just food it’s a place to make a difference, enjoy great company, and build stronger community ties. We also support our local SEN Oakwood Secondary school for work experience, who make cakes fortnightly.

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.
properties.title: Stockingford Community Centre

properties.address: Water Orton Methodist Church, 2 Birmingham Road, Water Orton, B46 1TL
properties.description:
Community event open to all. Serving Jacket Potatoes from our Victorian Style Oven. Range of toppings including our weekly special. Hot drinks, food and cake too. All on a donation basis. Puzzles too and lego for Kids of all ages. Open every Monday to everyone. Volunteer positions available.

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.
properties.title: Spud Club

properties.address: 19A Parkfield Rd, Coleshill, Birmingham B46 3LD
properties.description:
During our opening hours, anyone is welcome to come in and warm up. We have books, computers, puzzles and a range of free activities for all ages happening throughout the week, check out our Eventbrite page for the most up to date events programme!
While you’re here, why not join the library for free to take full advantage of everything we have to offer? We’d love to welcome you as a member!

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.

hours._text: Monday, Wednesday, Friday & Saturday 9.30am-12.30pm Tuesday & Thursday 9.30am-12.30pm & 1.30pm-5.30pm

properties.address: Hurley Village Hall, Knowle Hill, Hurley, CV9 2JD
properties.description:
A warm welcome with hot beverages provided free of charge (donations are welcome). Open to all ages and dogs. We will be also offering some free exercise classes, quizzes, bingo through the autumn and winter. Citizens Advice are visiting on 1st October to offer advice and support to pensioners whom may be able to apply for Pensioners Credit.

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.
properties.title: Hurley Community Hub

properties.address: Saints Nuneaton, Newdegate Street, CV114ED
properties.description:
During our opening hours, anyone is welcome to come in and warm up, there is no pressure to purchase anything from our coffee shop. We have board games and lego, as well as a mini library of books to read! We also operate a pay it forward scheme, meaning every day there is a selection of meals and hot drinks available to be claimed for free by anyone in need. We have a range of free and low cost community activities happening during the week, check out our website for the most up to date events programme!

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.
properties.title: Saints Nuneaton Central

properties.address: Warton Parish Rooms, Maypole Road, Warton, B79 0JH
properties.description:
Coffee and chat, open to all in Warton and the surrounding villages in North Warwickshire. Come to a warm space and enjoy light refreshments while meeting others. We offer a selection of games and cards, but please feel free to bring your own activities – knitting, crochet etc

Free refreshments, donations welcome.

This information is provided by a community group so it is advisable to check opening times with them directly, particularly over holiday periods.

Coffee Corner
Drop in for complimentary refreshments and enjoy a relaxing afternoon in the library. We’ll have board games, puzzles, and digital tablets available for you to enjoy. We also have occasional speakers and special events (bookable through staff or via our Eventbrite page).
While you’re here, why not join the library for free to take full advantage of everything we have to offer? We’d love to welcome you as a member!

properties.description:
Ford Chats – We invite you to join us every Wednesday for coffee and conversation at Ford Chats 11am-12.

Additional activities also available, all drop-in and all FREE with refreshments included:

1st Wednesday, 10am -11am – ‘For d’love of books’ reading group. All welcome to listen or participate

3rd Wednesday, 10am -12 – Discover your family history with help from the Nuneaton Local History Group.

While you’re here, why not join the library for free to take full advantage of everything we have to offer? We’d love to welcome you as a member!
